兵鎚戰前 場刊現雲加感言

【now.com體育】周五阿仙奴主帥雲加突然宣佈季後離開球隊，而在周日對陣韋斯咸前，他在比賽場刊當中撰文，向全體職球員表示滿滿的感謝。

作為「兵工廠」阿仙奴22年主帥的雲加（Arsene Wenger），最終決定於球季完結之後離開。在周日戰韋斯咸之前，他在比賽場刊中道出他的感受：「經過慎重的考慮，與及跟球會的討論之後，我認為是時候在季尾離開了。我希望感謝球會的職員、球員，球會主席與及球迷，是你們成就了阿仙奴的獨特。我對球會的愛與支持會直到永遠，而我亦呼籲球迷繼續支持球隊，讓我們以高姿態完成這個球季。」

後衛梅迪薩卡強調球員都是周五才得悉雲加離「廠」的消息，並認為球隊現時是時侯為這名法籍主帥付出，希望為領隊贏下歐霸盃，因為他值得拿著錦標離開阿仙奴。

作為英超的另一長青領隊，雲加可說是帶領阿仙奴爭取過不少輝煌戰績。而外間估計，阿仙奴名宿韋拉、前紅軍主帥羅渣士都有機會成為下任「兵工廠」主帥。

圖片來源 : ©AFP

David Moyes' warning to Arsene Wenger's replacement-in-waiting as Arsenal begin search for new manager

David Moyes has told Arsene Wenger’s replacement-in-waiting: Don’t be put off by fear of living in his shadow.

The Scot knows all too well about following in the footsteps of one long-serving managerial legend.

Moyes suffered a rough ride and survived just 10 months at Manchester United, despite being personally handpicked by Sir Alex Ferguson to replace him in 2013.

A similar baptism of fire could await the new man at Arsenal with the Frenchman standing down this summer.

Moyes, who picked the baton up from Ferguson following 26 trophy laden years, says the Gunners job shouldn’t be seen as a poisoned chalice.

He said: “My advice for anyone would be take it. Embrace it, because they’re a great club.

“You should have no fear - 100 per cent.

“And you can never refuse an opportunity like that.

“I’m not an expert on Arsenal, but Arsene will leave that club in great shape with a great academy system.

“They have tried to push young players and you have to admire them for that.”

Moyes knows too well all about the pitfalls of being handed the top job at a big club following his ill-fated reign at Old Trafford.

He looked to stamp his own mark and immediately brought in his own backroom staff as part of a shake-up behind the scenes.

But Moyes never won over the United fans who still yearned for Fergie while his new team badly under-performed. He was axed with four games remaining of his first season in charge.

“It’s an incredible achievement for Arsene as it was for Sir Alex Ferguson,” he added.

“Under him at Arsenal they have changed a lot.

“I was a great admirer of George Graham, but Arsene has gradually altered that.

“He’s been one of the best managers to grace the Premier League. People in the know understand what he has done and the level of football he has produced.”

Moyes expects world football will be put on alert by the news - whether the 68-year-old decides to stay on in management or call it a day.

“I think Arsene Wenger could have the pick of a host of international jobs,” added Moyes.

“When the World Cup is over he will be the No.1 target for a number of countries wanting him to be their coach. There will be lots of countries interested in him.

“He may stay in the Premier League because he’s a proper football man.

“But he is someone who looks to develop things because we’re not getting managers with 22 years in one job anymore.

“It wouldn’t surprise me if he continued working somewhere.

Moyes expects world football will be put on alert by the news - whether the 68-year-old decides to stay on in management or call it a day.

“I have to hope Arsenal players will have one eye on the semi final and won’t want to get injured,” added Moyes.

”I just hope some of their players will have their eyes non that more than on us. But this news changes everything.

“It may have changed the tone of a game when you go there and try to keep everybody quiet. Now everybody will probably go there to show their appreciation of what he has done.


“And given all that positivity I’m sure their players will be up for it.”
